questionnaireInfo.text:
Thank you for taking the time to participate in this survey.

 

Please visit our website for more information

question.text: Name
Position
Organization
Telephone
Email

sectionInfo.text: Please look at the map below. The red areas show the expansion area of the city between the years 1990-2010.
PART I : LAND OWNERSHIP, LAND TRANSACTIONS, AND PROPERTY RIGHTS IN THE EXPANSION AREA

The survey has three parts. The first part asks questions about property ownership and rights in the expansion areas of the city, the second part focuses on land use regulations, and the third part focuses on the subdivision of land into residential plots. We are interested in the single answer that applies to all or most of the land in the Expansion Area. If a single answer does not apply to approximately 80% of the land in the expansion area, we will ask you to write a short note explaining the situation in your city. If a question does not make sense to you, we want to understand why so that we obtain accurate information for your city. 

View Map
Government land acquisition for Urban Development

question.text: 1.0 Ownership of land in the expansion area is (check one):

category.label: Mostly public (government ministries, agencies and institutions)
No answer applies to all or most of the expansion area

question.text: Notes:
1.1 The land registry/cadaster on the urban periphery is:

category.label: No answer applies to all or most of the urban periphery

question.text: Notes:
1.2 Contractual agreements regarding land transactions on the urban periphery are:

category.label: No answer applies to all or most of the urban periphery

question.text: Notes:
1.3 Land in the following types of ownership can be leased for private residential development for long periods:

category.label: Land owned by government ministries, agencies and institutions

question.text: 1.3.1 Tribal/customary
1.3.2 Rural communes
1.3.3 Nationalized land
1.3.4 Land owned by government ministries, agencies and institutions
1.3.5 Municipal land
1.3.6 Other (Specify)
2.0 During the last decade, land acquisition for urban development on the urban periphery by government (in all its forms) has been:
2.1 During the last decade, land development on the urban periphery was:

category.label: All or mostly on land acquired by the government
Partially on land acquired by the government
Never or almost never on land acquired by the government
No answer applies to all or most of the urban periphery

question.text: Notes:
2.2 During the last decade, land for urban development on the urban periphery was acquired by the government through:

category.label: Expropriation with compensation at land-­‐market values
No answer applies to all or most of the urban periphery

question.text: Notes:
3.0 Were there any new squatter settlements on the urban periphery in the last decade?
3.1 In your opinion, compared to earlier years, the formation of new squatter settlements is:
3.2 If there were new settlements in the last decade, they were located:

category.label: On both public and private lands

question.text: 3.3 What is the most prevalent type of squatter settlement?

category.label: Organized invasion by Group of Squatters
Gradual unorganized infiltration by Individual Squatter Families
Area occupied Illegally by Some Squatters, land subdivided into plots, and then plots sold

question.text: 3.4 How often during the last decade have squatter settlements been demolished and their residents evicted?
3.4.1 Does demolition and eviction require a court order?
3.4.2 Is notice of the plan to demolish given in advance?
3.4.3 Are resettlement areas being offered?
3.4.4 Are there compensation packages offered to evictees?

sectionInfo.text: PART II : LAND USE REGULATION IN THE EXPANSION AREA

question.text: 4.0 Is there a well-publicized and well-understood zoning and land use plan in force, which shows where urban development is not allowed, and what areas need to be reserved for public works and public open spaces?

category.label: No answer applies to all or most of the expansion area

question.text: Notes:
4.1 Are there consultations with the public at early and middle stages of the plan-making process?

category.label: No answer applies to all or most of the expansion area

question.text: Notes:
4.1.1 Were there public hearings prior to approving the plan?

category.label: No answer applies to all or most of the expansion area

question.text: Notes:
4.1.2 Did the public affect any changes in the plan?
4.2 What is the typical time between plan revisions in the expansion area?

directive.text: Note: if the plan is revised every X months, the answer is X/12 years.

question.text: 4.3 Is the zoning and land use plan respected:
5.0 Is containing the expansion of the city an explicit goal of the zoning and land use plan?

category.label: No answer applies to all or most of the expansion area

question.text: Notes:
5.1 Are regulations that prohibit development on specific plots in the expansion area respected:
5.2 If the plan does seek to limit the expansion of the city, is it by using any of the following containment strategies? (check all that apply):

category.label: Defining quotas on the amount of land that can be converted to urban use
Defining quotas on the issue of building permits
No answer applies to all or most of the expansion area

question.text: Notes:
5.3 How long does it typically take to convert rural land on the urban periphery to urban use?

directive.text: Note: If the city converts land every X months, then the answer is X/12 years.

subQuestion.text: A single plot of rural land

question.text: Notes:

sectionInfo.text: PART III : SUBDIVISION OF LAND ON THE URBAN PERIPHERY

Note: The answers to the following questions pertain to new residential land subdivisions at the neighborhood level, typically of the order of city blocks or a 200-unit land subdivision project, excluding arterial roads or inter-city roads.
View Map
8.0 Share of Subdivided Land in Plots for Sale
Average Time to Obtain all Permits for a Typical 200-unit Land Subdivision
Illegal Subdivisions  and Sale of Residential Plots

question.text: 6.0 When land is converted to urban use, who designs the street layout and the subdivision of land into plots?

category.label: No answer applies to all or most of the expansion area

question.text: Notes:
6.1 Who constructs infrastructure services (roads, water supply, sewerage, drainage etc.)?

category.label: No answer applies to all or most of the expansion area

question.text: Notes:
7.0 Do land subdivision regulations mandate a minimum street width in front of residential plots?

category.label: No answer applies to all or most of the expansion area

question.text: Notes:
7.0.1 Specify minimum street width in meters:
When a typical project is subdivided into plots, what share of the land is in plots that can be sold?
What share of the land is in other uses (streets, open spaces, public facilities, public land reserves, etc.)?

directive.text: Note: The two should add up to 100%

question.text: Notes:
9.0 Do residential land subdivision regulations mandate a minimum plot size?

category.label: No answer applies to all or most of the expansion area

question.text: Note:
9.0.1 Specify minimum plot size:
9.1 Is there a maximum plot size?

category.label: No answer applies to all or most of the expansion area

question.text: 9.1.1 Specify maximum plot size:
Notes:
10.0 Do land subdivision regulations mandate a minimum amount of land designated as public open space (other than streets and sidewalks)?

category.label: No answer applies to all or most of the expansion area

question.text: 10.0.1 Check all that apply:

category.label: Public open space (area per person) in the land being developed
Share of the land being developed
Contribute to public open space development elsewhere

question.text: Public open space area per person:
Notes:
Share of land being developed:
Other criteria:
11.0 Are there limitations on the maximum sizes of residential buildings?

category.label: No answer applies to all or most of the expansion area

question.text: 11.0.1 check all that apply:

category.label: Maximum number of dwelling units per hectare

question.text: What is the maximum Floor Area Ratio (FAR) allowed?
What is the maximum height allowed in meters?
What is the maximum number of dwellings per hectare allowed?
What is the maximum plot coverage allowed?
Notes:
11.1 How often are there violations of the maximum building size regulations?
12.0 What is the share of residential area on the urban fringe where construction of multi-family buildings is allowed?

category.label: A small share of the area

question.text: 12.0.1 Can single-family units be internally sub-divided into multi-family units?
12.0.2 Can additional dwelling units be added over time to single-family units?
12.0.3 Can additional floors be added over time to existing buildings?
12.0.4 Is mixed use of plots (for residences and workplaces) allowed?
13.0 What is the typical time (in months) needed to obtain all the necessary permits for a 200-unit land subdivision on land already converted to urban use?
13.1 Once land subdivision is approved, what is the typical additional time required to get all building permits?
13.2 Type of subdivision that you are referring to:

category.label: Individual dwelling units on individual plots of land

question.text: 14.0 How common is it, during the last ten years for land brokers to buy rural land, subdivide it into plots and sell plots (with no services or with minimal services) that do not conform to land use regulations or to land subdivision regulations?
14.0.1 what is the typical plot size in these subdivisions?
14.0.2 what is the typical street width in these subdivisions?
14.0.3 What is the typical number of plots in such subdivisions?
14.0.4 What was the largest subdivision completed in the last decade?
15.0 Are there built-up land subdivisions on the urban periphery that are not connected to the municipal water supply?
15.0.1 What is their source of water?
